text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

It's kind of cliche, but
at the end of the day

it comes down to, I want
to make the American dream
a reality for more people.

And that whole idea that if you
work hard and are really smart

you can do whatever
you want in our society

- there's - data doesn't
show that that's not really
the case.

I was a first-generation
college student.

For me to end up at a place like
HBS on top of all the hard work

and drive that I
had to have, I also

had to get very, very
lucky a lot of times.

And I just want to make
sure other people don't
have to get as lucky.

Super tactically, I think that
means fixing our K-12 education
system.

If every person has
access to pre-K,

if every person who graduates
high school knows how to read,

over time we'll see these
disparities gotten rid of,

and that's what I want to
spend my life focusing on.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
